name: Qiang Fu 0011
content: Qiang Fu | Te Kura Mātai Pūkaha, Pūrorohiko / School of Engineering and Computer Science | Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington Qiang Fu Please Note This person can no longer be contacted through the School of Engineering and Computer Science at Victoria University of Wellington Qualifications BE (Harbin), MEngSc (Adelaide), MBA (QUT), PhD (UQ) Research Interests My research interests are in the areas of Internet architecture and protocols Wireless and mobile systems Cyber-physical systems Network measurement and security Machine learning in networking I manage the Networking Research Lab. Publications For a list of my recent publications, please see the Publications Database. Projects and Scholarships Scholarships are available for students who are highly motivated and have good grades (A- or above) or significant research/industry experience. For projects on offer, please refer to the Networking Research Lab. These projects are also available for students looking for Summer Scholarships and Honours projects. Biography I received my PhD in Telecommunications Engineering from The University of Queensland in 2005. Prior to joining Victoria University of Wellington, I was a research fellow at University of South Australia and Swinburne University. Before I moved into academia, I held different positions at China Aerospace Corporation and Mitsubishi Mobile Communications. I received Best Paper Award in Australian Telecommunication Networks and Applications Conference 2004 (ATNAC 2004). Print version | Backlinks |
